source.title: A report claims left-wing terrorism is rising. The data paints a complicated picture

facts: The assassination of conservative commentator Charlie Kirk occurred.

Federal law enforcement authorities and non-governmental researchers have found the far right to be the most 'lethal and persistent' domestic terrorist threat, citing examples like racially motivated mass killings at an African American church in Charleston, S.C., a Walmart in El Paso in 2019, and a grocery store in Buffalo, N.Y., in 2022.

The CSIS study analyzed roughly 30 years of data to find that between Jan. 1 and July 4 of this year (2025), the number of far-left terrorist plots and attacks outnumbered those from the far right, with five instances coded as left-wing terrorism during the first half of 2025.
The single act that CSIS's study coded as right-wing terrorism was a shooting in Minnesota involving state representatives Melissa Hortman and her husband John Hortman.

neutral.headline: CSIS Study Finds More Left-Wing Than Right-Wing Domestic Terrorist Incidents in Early 2025
neutral.body_html: A study by the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) analyzed data over roughly three decades, revealing a shift in domestic terrorism trends. The CSIS report found that from January to July of this year, there were more far-left than right-wing plots or attacks.

conservative.headline: CSIS Study Reveals Increase in Left-Wing Domestic Terrorism Despite Far Right Threats
conservative.body_html: A recent study by the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) has identified a rise in left-wing domestic terrorist activities, with five incidents coded as such during early 2025. This comes despite historical data showing that far right groups have been more 'lethal and persistent' according to federal authorities.

liberal.headline: CSIS Study Codes Five Left-Wing Domestic Terrorism Incidents in First Half of 2025, Amidst Far Right Concerns
liberal.body_html: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) study indicates a rise in left-wing domestic terrorist activities with five incidents coded as such from January to July 2025. This is noteworthy, especially considering the historical prevalence of far right threats.
